alert.note: Alert for Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; San Rafael Swell; Southern Mountains; Western Canyonlands (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wayne...southwestern Emery and southeastern Sevier Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 427 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Torrey, or 15 miles northwest of Capitol Reef National Park, moving east at 15 mph. This includes a portion of Capitol Reef National Park. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Capitol Reef National Park, Torrey and Teasdale. This includes the following highways... Utah Route 12 near mile marker 122. Utah Route 24 between mile markers 64 and 77. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; San Rafael Swell; Southern Mountains; Western Canyonlands
